alert.note: Alert for Fulton; Herkimer (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 06 at 8:17PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of eastern New York, including the following counties, Fulton and Herkimer. * WHEN...Until 800 AM EDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of small rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 806 PM EDT, trained weather spotters reported flooding in the warned area due to runoff from recent rainfall and snowmelt. Flooding is occurring. - Flooding is occurring along the Spruce Creek crossing Route 29 in the town of Salisbury, with minor flooding of surrounding flat lands. Also, the East Canada Creek in Dolgeville is bankfull to out of its banks in low flatland areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dolgeville, Oppenheim, Rasbach Corner, Ingham Mills, Shedd Corners, Doxtater Corner, Ingham Mills Station, Manheim Center and Garlock Corners. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
